articles.headline: Europeans Reach Deal on Rescue Plan for Greece
articles.snippet: The plan for intervention, if needed, would use money from the International Monetary Fund and bilateral loans from the 16 countries that use the euro.
articles.abstract: The plan for intervention, if needed, would use money from the International Monetary Fund and bilateral loans from the 16 countries that use the euro.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — After months of fractious debate, the 16 countries that use the euro agreed on a financial safety net for Greece, combining bilateral loans from those European nations with cash from the International Monetary Fund.
articles.byline: By Stephen Castle and Matthew Saltmarsh

articles.headline: More Doctors Giving Up Private Practices
articles.snippet: The delivery of medical care is changing as more young physicians take jobs with heath systems.
articles.abstract: The delivery of medical care is changing as more young physicians take jobs with heath systems.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A quiet revolution is transforming how medical care is delivered in this country, and it has very little to do with the sweeping health care legislation that President Obama just signed into law.

articles.headline: U.S. Plans Big Expansion in Effort to Aid Homeowners
articles.snippet: The Obama administration plans to announce a broad initiative to provide more assistance to homeowners who are behind on their mortgage or owe more than their house is worth.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration plans to announce a broad initiative to provide more assistance to homeowners who are behind on their mortgage or owe more than their house is worth.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration on Friday will announce broad new initiatives to help troubled homeowners, potentially refinancing several million of them into fresh government-backed mortgages with lower payments.

articles.headline: American Terror Suspect Traveled Unimpeded
articles.snippet: David C. Headley scouted targets in India and met with a senior Al Qaeda operative in Pakistan.
articles.abstract: David C. Headley scouted targets in India and met with a senior Al Qaeda operative in Pakistan.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — An American charged with helping plan the 2008 terrorist attacks in Mumbai, India, moved effortlessly between the United States, Pakistan and India for nearly seven years, training at a militant camp in Pakistan on five occasions, according to a plea agreement released by the Justice Department last week.

articles.headline: China Officials Wrestle Publicly Over Currency
articles.snippet: Leaders are engaged in a bitter struggle over whether to allow the renminbi to rise against the dollar or to escalate a war of words with the U.S.
articles.abstract: Leaders are engaged in a bitter struggle over whether to allow the renminbi to rise against the dollar or to escalate a war of words with the U.S.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Signs are emerging of conflicting views among China’s leaders over whether to allow the country’s currency to rise against the dollar.

articles.headline: Emirate Offers to Help Restructure Dubai World
articles.snippet: Dubai will inject $9.5 billion to keep two companies that symbolized the emirate’s lavish spending from failing and defaulting on their debts.
articles.abstract: Dubai will inject $9.5 billion to keep two companies that symbolized the emirate’s lavish spending from failing and defaulting on their debts.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dubai moved on Thursday to recapitalize two companies at the heart of a financial crisis that shook global markets last autumn, saying that it would inject up to $9.5 billion into Dubai World and its property subsidiary and would seek to repay all creditors within eight years.
articles.byline: By Landon Thomas Jr. and David Jolly

articles.headline: Legal-Marijuana Advocates Focus on a New Green
articles.snippet: The effort to legalize the drug in California will not dwell on effects or social acceptance, but on economic benefits.
articles.abstract: The effort to legalize the drug in California will not dwell on effects or social acceptance, but on economic benefits.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Perhaps only in California could a group of marijuana smokers call themselves fiscal realists.

articles.headline: Memo to Pope Described Transfer of Pedophile Priest
articles.snippet: The future Pope Benedict XVI was kept more closely apprised of a sexual abuse case in Germany than previous church statements have suggested.
articles.abstract: The future Pope Benedict XVI was kept more closely apprised of a sexual abuse case in Germany than previous church statements have suggested.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUNICH — The future Pope Benedict XVI was kept more closely apprised of a sexual abuse case in Germany than previous church statements have suggested, raising fresh questions about his handling of a scandal unfolding under his direct supervision before he rose to the top of the church’s hierarchy.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Kulish and Katrin Bennhold

articles.headline: Political Tide Could Wash Away Utah Senator
articles.snippet: Robert F. Bennett, a Republican seeking a fourth term, may be threatened by dissatisfaction with Washington.
articles.abstract: Robert F. Bennett, a Republican seeking a fourth term, may be threatened by dissatisfaction with Washington.
articles.lead_paragraph: SALT LAKE CITY — Senator Robert F. Bennett parked his white Acura, walked through the doors of Bryant Middle School and stood alone as he began the obstacle course that will determine his political fate.

articles.headline: Allawi Victory in Iraq Sets Up Period of Uncertainty
articles.snippet: A secular coalition led by Ayad Allawi, a former prime minister, won a wafer-thin victory, but challenges to the outcome could threaten plans to withdraw American troops.
articles.abstract: A secular coalition led by Ayad Allawi, a former prime minister, won a wafer-thin victory, but challenges to the outcome could threaten plans to withdraw American troops.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD — The secular party of Ayad Allawi, a former interim prime minister once derided as an American puppet, won a wafer-thin victory in Iraq’s election, setting the stage for a protracted period of political uncertainty and possible violence that could threaten plans to withdraw American troops.
articles.byline: By Timothy Williams and Rod Nordland

articles.headline: A Bold U.S. Plan to Help Struggling Homeowners
articles.snippet: The new measures are aimed not only at the households that are behind on their mortgages but at the 11 million that simply owe more on their homes than they are worth.
articles.abstract: The new measures are aimed not only at the households that are behind on their mortgages but at the 11 million that simply owe more on their homes than they are worth.
